channel.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/CajTnwS.png[/img]
[SIZE=5][B][COLOR=ORANGE]Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake[/COLOR][/B][/SIZE]
[B][SIZE=2]Welcome to the project thread for Scape-2006. I have been working on this remake for almost 2 years now, and it has been a source that's been used for other remakes as well. Most people have stopped development on their remakes after they feel that they are done with it, but I have had the very large goal of creating the most advanced 2006 remake that there ever was. This thread will cover what I have done, and what I plan to do in the future. Since it is now summer break for me, I have a lot of free time to work on this too. Without further a do, let's get into my progress.[/SIZE][/B]
[SIZE=4][COLOR=GRAY][B]Unique Content[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SPOILER=Show] [COLOR=GREEN]- Xml Player Saving - Add new saving content to the player without issues! Load character data quickly and easily. - Minigames (Duel Arena, Castle Wars, Mage Arena, Barrows) - New random event system - Extended region music system - Skillcapes - Reworked NPC drops (More accurate drops, more monsters) - Proper npc world spawns - NvN Combat (Npc vs. Npc) - Function Keys[/COLOR] [/SPOILER]
[SIZE=4][COLOR=GRAY][B]Quests[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SPOILER=Show] [COLOR=ORANGE][B]28 Fully Functional Quests![/B][/COLOR]
[COLOR=ORANGE][B]FREE QUESTS[/B][/COLOR] [COLOR=GREEN] - Black Knights' Fortress - Cook's Assistant - Demon Slayer - Doric's Quest - Dragon Slayer - Goblin Diplomacy - Imp Catcher - The Knight's Sword - Pirate's Treasure - The Restless Ghost - Romeo & Juliet - Rune Mysteries Quest - Sheep Shearer - Shield of Arrav - Vampire Slayer - Witch's Potion [/COLOR] [COLOR=ORANGE][B]MEMBER'S QUESTS[/B][/COLOR] [COLOR=GREEN] - Clock Tower - Death Plateau - Druidic Ritual - Elemental Workshop - Fishing Contest - The Grand Tree - Lost City - Monkey Madness - Monk's Friend - Sheep Herder - Tree Gnome Village - Waterfall Quest [/COLOR]
[/SPOILER]
[SIZE=4][COLOR=GRAY][B]Skills[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SPOILER=Show] [COLOR=GREEN] - Fully Functional Combat (Hitpoints, Attack, Strength, Defence, Ranged, Prayer, Magic - All with proper formulas, XP balancing, and hit calculating) - Runecrafting [/COLOR][COLOR=green]- Agility (Gnome Course, Barbarian Course, [COLOR=orange]Wilderness Course[/COLOR])[/COLOR][COLOR=green] - Herblore - Thieving - Crafting - Fletching - Slayer - Mining - Smithing - Fishing - Cooking - Firemaking - Woodcutting [/COLOR][COLOR=ORANGE]- Farming (Need to work out object detection in crop data)[/COLOR] [/SPOILER]
[SIZE=4][COLOR=GRAY][B]Media[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SPOILER=Show] Login Screen [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/5bYyy5Q.png[/img]
28 Fully Functional Quests
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/7ugIHjk.png[/img]
Castle Wars [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/0mqQx2e.png[/img]
Random Events [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Nkg2uWl.png[/img]
New Combat and Skill tab interfaces
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Fo6Pfq2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/hWUCDUe.png[/img]
Once you've received a level 99 in a skill, speak to the Wise Old Man to buy your skillcape! [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/fRyFUvT.png[/img]
Gnome and Barbarian Agility Courses! [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/l3eC7vu.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/vGL4mtk.png[/img]
Al-Kharid Warriors [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/BQiYBNn.png[/img]
Duel Arena - Fully functional, bug free, dupe free [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/GUxpZAe.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/62RYNfp.png[/img]
Region Music [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/HS5o83F.png[/img]
3rd Age from clue scrolls! [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Yun2NzX.png[/img]
MyBB RSC Theme - Work in Progress [IMG]http://puu.sh/hPqC9/04bd4b9a2b.jpg[/img] [/SPOILER]
[SIZE=3][COLOR=gray][B]Release is on July 1st, 2015![/B][/COLOR][/SIZE] [SIZE=3][COLOR=gray][B]Please feel free to register on our [color=blue][URL=http://www.scape-2006.com/]forums[/URL][/COLOR] for more updates.[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]
[SIZE=4][COLOR=GRAY][B]Credits[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE] 2006Scape 06Prime Paradox Syn[/CENTER]

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @runetopia runetopia
item.description:
@runetopia wrote:

Pest:

2006 is ugly lol

That is true lol
P.s: Who the heck cares about saving? Yes, you may find it easy to parse but players need content not some saving nonsense…

QUOTE:

iN2AYiL.png1028×59

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

i heard json is easy to parse, human read/edit, and has native data types. i heard xml is bloated, an eyesore, can’t be parsed with a regular expression, and doesn’t have data types.

Read full topic

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:7, topic:551910”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=670826.msg4485749#msg4485749 date=1433885667]

How is any of this unique? XML player saving is not only slow but it’s been something that’s been done for years and I wouldn’t recommend it. Saving it in a binary format is much faster, however not editable directly, which isn’t exactly a bad thing. The solution is to make an external program to read your player saving format, much more secure.
[/quote]Can you elaborate on this because I’m not seeing it. XML saving is perfectly fine, I doubt the speed would be much of a concern in this scale of application.[/quote]
The comment you marked in bold was stating the solution to edit the binary files is to make an external program to read the player saving format. I mean, you could just put a class to do it right in the server but you can get more creative with a secondary application. General point is that binary is more secure because it isn’t directly editable like XML would be, wouldn’t really matter as long as the developer carefully edited the files, or allowed anybody else to get near them. My main point overall was that XML player saving really isn’t a unique content or even anything worth mentioning since there are better options, and it’s seen in alot of server releases anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:5, topic:551910”]
How is any of this unique? XML player saving is not only slow but it’s been something that’s been done for years and I wouldn’t recommend it. Saving it in a binary format is much faster, however not editable directly, which isn’t exactly a bad thing. The solution is to make an external program to read your player saving format, much more secure.[/quote]Can you elaborate on this because I’m not seeing it. XML saving is perfectly fine, I doubt the speed would be much of a concern in this scale of application.

Read full topic

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

The reason why I’m saying this is unique is because usually, no remakes have had this kind of content. Also, I know that xml player saving has been done before. But, like I just said, usually no other 2006 remakes that are based off of Runesource do not use this version of saving.

Read full topic

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:


How is any of this unique? XML player saving is not only slow but it’s been something that’s been done for years and I wouldn’t recommend it. Saving it in a binary format is much faster, however not editable directly, which isn’t exactly a bad thing. The solution is to make an external program to read your player saving format, much more secure.

item.title: Scape-2006 - The Most Advanced 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

Mezzyscape562:

Will not play but I will say good luck to you. Hopefully this will go far. Don’t give up like the rest of us.

I haven’t given up since I started development back in my 2006Revived days :). I’m extremely dedicated towards this server, and thank you very much for the support!
